That looks fine, 

With regards to "Kitsite to confirm that WAF in passive Mode had not impacted site" what level of testing are you expecting us to carry out?

I assume that as your only running WAF in passive Mode the moment the potential impact on the site is extremely low and therefore you just need us to test that certain key pages or functionality (TBD *) are responding / working as expected and that a full regression test of every feature / page on the site isn't required (obviously this could be prohibitively time consuming / expensive).

Jamie

* would it be enough to check that say the home page, registration and search are functioning as expected? I wonder if it makes sense to outline a couple of possible test plans (basic/detailed) we can agree to running against the site, although obviously preparing such a test plan in itself will involve a certain amount of work.

Jamie

The test plan is intended to be generic, and can be used for testing the site in contexts other than the introduction of Akamai's WAF.
A quick note to confirm that we are awaiting feedback on what ITS want us to test and when.
Belatedly closing this one.

I'm making some updates to the Events section and when trying to rename pages, I keep getting this error message which prevents me from doing so. While it is correct to say there is a similarly named item, I don't think this should prevent me from saving a document title in the way it currently is.

Please could someone have a look at this?

Thanks,

Michael

Content Coordinator
Editorial Services department
Direct line:  +44 (0)20 3 2012 046

One Churchill Place
Canary Wharf
London E14 5LN

Fax: +44 (0)20 7719 1308
london2012.comhttp://www.london2012.com/
Michael, can you give me the exact old name and new name? Thanks.

Hi

Old name - Active Travel Programme: Get Walking for the Games -Olympic Games Rowing Venue

New name - London 2012 active travel programme: Get Walking for the Games - Olympic Games Rowing Venue

Thanks

There is an upper limit on the file name length, so that:

London 2012 active travel programme: Get Walking for the Games - Olympic Games Rowing Venue and
London 2012 active travel programme: Get Walking for the Games, Waltham Abbey

both by default have the same file name:

london-2012-active-travel-programme-get-walking-for-the-.php

The way round this is to rename the title without renaming the file, but you don't have rights to do that.

There are different solutions:

1) ask Morag or Liz to ask us to upgrade all "Default" users so they can "edit file name"
2) ask Morag or Liz to ask us create a new role that we can assign to you that will allow you to "edit file name"
3) just ask us to rename the pages, if there are only a couple of them.

"edit file name" means that you can change the title of an item without also forcing a change to the file name (and vice versa).

cc. Liz, Morag

Hi,

Ok cool thanks I’ll have a word with one of them.

Can you confirm which Liz you mean? I only started here last week

Thanks!

Me! In the short term – I’m happy for kitsite to just do the renames.

Cheers,

Liz

Liz, it's also very trivial to change capabilities. In fact, if, as anticipated, there are going to be more users on the system over the next few months it might be worth having a short discussion about what CMS capabilities you want to expose to different users.

Sorry danny – i think i would prefer not to have all default users able to start bopping about with file names ... i don’t have a problem with you creating a new role for Michael (don’t think i can do that myself?) so in the mean time if you can change the name, then we can set up the new role?

comments.value:
Hello

We need to put up a splash page for the close of Ticket sales on Tuesday. This will remind people that ticket sales close at 11.59pm on Tuesday and send them straight through to the Ticketing site.

We are still deciding whether this page will go up tomorrow night (ahead of the weekend) or first thing on Tuesday morning, but I suspect the former. I will try to get the page to you asap but it will likely be tomorrow am.

Thanks!
OK. Got it.

Update on this - it's less onerous than we feared ;-)

We are *not* going to put up the splash page ahead of Tuesday (unless there is exceptional load on our website - see below). The plan is therefore to put up the splash page first thing on Tuesday - by 8am if possible? I have edited the splash page we used for Tickets launch and is already live at http://www.london2012.com/splash/index.html - it therefore just needs putting into position on Tuesday.

The one exception would be if we required to put up the splash page over the course of the weekend. This would *only* be in extreme circumstances if the load on london2012.com were getting very heavy. The Technology team - Russ or Jonathan - would make contact with you to request this. Can you advise what would be the best way of making contact if this was required? NB if the page has to be deployed before Tuesday, it will need to be modified slightly from what is currently set up for Tuesday. You would need to substitute the page already in the Splash page folder called 'index spare', together with a different background image called 'bg spare.jpg'. These reflect the fact that if the page is deployed before Tuesday it isn't the 'final day'. 

Does that sound okay?

Morag,

I have updated the redirects page and assigned it to you (you may even have received an email about it). In order for the new splash page to take over, all we need to do is unlock and publish it at 8am on Tuesday (and probably best not to attempt to publish any Short URLs before then)

I will be around on Tuesday. Please call me if I don't turn up on Skype before 7.45.

Hi

Our editorial team want to make some changes to the site's main drop down nav, as some of the descriptions are missing/out of date. If there's a way to do this ourselves then please let me know. The changes are:

Get Involved Now

Cultural Olympiad  = The London 2012 Games is for everyone

Visiting in 2012

Tickets = Find out about tickets for the Games

Making it Happen

Testing programme = A key part of preparations for London 2012

The Games
Olympic Torch Relay = Spreading the excitement of the Olympic Games
Paralympic Torch Relay = Generating excitement for the Paralympic Games

Thanks

Hi Fiona,

Are you refereeing to the drop down bit when you select one of the main tabs?

If so that text is pulled form the meta-description field on the associated index page, so update that index page and republish.

You'll then need to preview 'Nav Dropdown' (nav-dropdown.php) with a clear cache parameter like so (as it's a special page with caching)
http://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/preview/includes/nav-dropdown.php?mode=publish&cache=false

If that looks OK then just republish 'Nav Dropdown' /includes/nav-dropdown.php

Jamie
Fantastic – that’s exactly what we were after. Thanks so much.
Sorted

From Justin:


The image sent through earlier today by debs was 114061516MC009_Annoucement_.JPG and it is not showing on the FTP. I have just sent 114061516MC008_Annoucement_.JPG so you have something sent within the last 10 minutes which I can see on the FTP so might be worth waiting to see if it makes it through..

Quick question: can you confirm that the "post date" is being filled in?

I am having a look at http://gettyftp.kitsite.com/images.php and I can't see it. I think we need it. See jamie's comment: "There is a date field called 'post date' which is the only that one is used" in #2842. I may be clutching at straws, but as nothing has changed on this end and i expect nothing has changed on the getty end, it is likely to be something different about the data that is being entered. It may just be a matter of identifying what that is.

Actually, looking again, this may be a red herring. I think the field we are after is 'Date Photo Taken' and it does appear to be included in recent files. Will let you know if I have any more thoughts on this one.

Actually, I think the problem is pretty straight forward. The image files are not on the server.

e.g. http://gettyftp.kitsite.com/images.php?action=get&path=18-May-2011_15_18_13%2f114061516MC009_Annoucement_%284%29.JPG

To be specific, the XML data is all there, but the images to which they apparently refer are not. 

It is possible that there is some issue with naming, possibly there are unexpected characters in the file name. could you get somebody to confirm that there are actually some image files on the server and what they might be called, or failing that, perhaps somebody could try putting some images in without extraneous characters like brackets, spaces and so forth, which could possibly be causing problems (I believe they have in the past).
Have you fed this back in with Getty? Or is that what you need me to do?

This is what Getty say – would that make sense?


Hi Liz,



Feedback from Getty is that the images are making it from Getty to the FTP as they should. From their test's what they believe is happening is that the images are going to the FTP and into Kitsite but the metadata isn't transferring and that is what is getting stuck on the FTP. Therefore the image goes into Kitsite but had no metadata attached.



The FTP has been cleared - so I will keep an eye on the image that is there at the moment and see if it gets through. Perhaps we can remedy this by logging in and clearing the FTP as and when an image appears to get stuck.



Thanks,

Justin.

OK. I have spoken to Justin and also to Sam at Getty. We could not track down the source of the problem. Patrick Stewart from Getty, who is more technical, is away til next week (as is Jamie), so we are going to defer further discussion until next week. But apparently the feed hasn't been running for three weeks. We are treating this as high priority.
Justin thought it might be strange characters in the names of images. Is that not the case?

We thought it might be and tried an experiment to prove that hypothesis, but the results were negative. If you are willing to wait until Monday then I will get Jamie to look at it when he gets back. But I can escalate this if it's really pressing.
If someone else could take a look in the meantime, that would be good. With torch and mascots birthday I suspect that there are a fair number of photos we could/should be sending through...

Kieran, have you got any familiarity with the getty stuff? I don't even have a login to our ftp server, so have no way of knowing whether we have any image files on there and why the path our feed is looking for is turning up a file-not-found error.

I have taken a look at this, and it appears that - as per Danny's suggestion - there are image files missing on the ftp server. I've checked our logs, and our feed code, and can't find any evidence of our feed deleting the image files. Is there any way we can request that the missing images be (re?)uploaded to the FTP server? I can then follow their progress to see what / if anything is going wrong.

Thanks
Kieran

I have just spoken to Sam Melo at Getty (020 3227 2293) who is going to get one of their techies (Andy) to call me back. I have called Justin to let him know what we are up to. I will update this ticket as soon as I hear back from Andy and will probably pass him on to you, Kieran.
Sam has called me back and given me Andy's number (020 3227 2489). I am going to call him tomorrow morning. Re-assigned to me.
Thank you!
I have spoken to Andy and sent him an email detailing the symptoms. He is handing this over to Patrick Stuart at Getty, who is back in the office on Monday. We will keep chasing.

Any update on this now that hopefully the Getty technical contact is back?

Beginning to get quite pressing...
It's still with Getty. I just spoke again to Andrew Bull who wil get back to me later today with feedback.

I have spoken again to Andy at Getty. We have created  a test directory for them on our ftp server, which they are going to use for testing purposes. As far we can tell, the issue is on their end, but we don't really know what it is. We are still receiving XML data (it looks like somebody tried to upload the same file "PE_190511WC3_002.JPG" three times yesterday), but we are not receiving any associated images.
Have they agreed any sort of time-scale for fixing or investigating it?
No. It would probably be helpful if somebody at Locog let them know that this is urgent.

From Andy at Getty:

> I acknowledge that the Static (jpg) asset was lost in transit, but the xml file was transferred successfully.
>
> I'm investigating this issue further, and in discussion with our Development team.
>

They are looking into this issue and we will update you as soon as we hear more.
Any further progress on this??

I emailed them yesterday, here was the response:

Dear Danny.

I've already chased our Development team this morning and I will provide an update to you tomorrow.

Our development team are investigating.

Thank you for your interest

Andy

Thanks, Danny.

Justin, it might be worth a chase on your side. It’s not terribly impressive they haven’t managed to update you on it directly!
Getty appear to have made progress. I am just awaiting confirmation that they are ready for you to test on your end.
Getty say: ready for testing.
Marking as solved.

Aaron Shone at LOCOG has asked for some information about users:
- brief summary of how users are exported to edialog
- full set of user fields in the UMS
- overview of our security (nothing too detailed, a page or two of A4 should suffice)
- pen testing. would we agree to pen testing of our system and would we rather it was done on our live system or on a clone for testing purposes. What would it cost for us to set up a clone for testing purposes?

Jamie, assigned to you for "brief summary of how users are exported to edialog".

Do that and then assign back to me.

A short summary of eDialog

- A daily delta feed is created by the CMS containing all users who have created, modified or expired their account since the last feed run
- The feed format is TSV (tab separated values)
- The file is sent as a encrypted zip file using the public key that eDialog supplied
- The zip/encryption is part of the feed generation code, we do not store an unencrypted version of the file at any point.
- The file is SFTP's to eDialog's FTP server

Handing over to Kieran now for a full set of user fields in the UMS and a security overview (i.e. a quick summary of how data, particularly user data, is stored and how we prevent third parties gaining access to it).

Hmm, I think they'll have serious issues with much of this, esp. 1 & 2 (esp. the (bracketed) part of 2.)
Although, having said that - this has always been the case, and always /openly/ been the case.
Perhaps we should discuss how to present this.

1. Data is stored in a shared database. Access to each client's data is restricted via row-level access control.

2. The database (is on the public internat, but) has a firewall in place to only allow database traffic from the Kitsite CMS servers.

3. We store the following data for each user:
	UserGUID
	additionalNames
	address1
	address2
	address3
	address4
	age
	businessAddress1
	businessAddress2
	businessAddress3
	businessAddress4
	businessAnnualTurnover
	businessAreaOfInterest
	businessCountry
	businessCounty
	businessHowDidYouHear
	businessJobTitle
	businessLevelOfSupport
	businessMessage
	businessOrganisationName
	businessPostcode
	businessProfile
	businessRegion
	businessSector
	businessSizeOfOrganisation
	businessTelephone
	businessTown
	businessUserGUID
	country
	county
	creationDate
	disability
	emailAuthenticationUrl
	emailformat
	ethnicity
	fax
	firstName
	gender
	governmentOfficeRegion
	homePhone
	infoThirdParties
	interestedInVolunteering
	internalComments
	lastName
	londonBorough
	mailingList
	mobilePhone
	nickname
	passwordResetUrl
	postcode
	sms
	title
	town
	volunteeringFamilyMembers
	yearOfBirth

4. We also store a one-way-encrypted password for each user.

description:
Aaron Shone at LOCOG has asked for some information about users:
- brief summary of how users are exported to edialog
- full set of user fields in the UMS
- overview of our security (nothing too detailed, a page or two of A4 should suffice)
- pen testing. would we agree to pen testing of our system and would we rather it was done on our live system or on a clone for testing purposes. What would it cost for us to set up a clone for testing purposes?
